title: MongoDB Commands
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This app supply a set of commands to search data from MongoDB

The app supply presente the following commands:

- mongoshowdb - lists all databases in MongoDb
- mongoshowcol db= - list all collection in specified database in MongDB
- mongofind db= collection= [''] - presents data in specified database and collection meet optional filter in json format


Example:

| mongoshowdb

	lists all databases

| mongoshowcol db=school

	list collections in database 'school'

| mongofind db=school collection=scores "{'score': { '$gt': 70 , '$lt': 90} }"

	list results whit score grather than 70 and less than 90 in collection scores in database school.


Limits:

	- it use only database without authentication
	- the filter is in json format
	- it use only one MongoDB instance

To Do:

	- connect to more MongoDb instance
	- configure and use authentication
	- accept filter in bson format
	- accept filter in SQL format

title: Splidgets - Splunkpad for Splunk
description:
A Splidget is a Splunk component that, in my mind, is not quite an app but does provide functionality to the end user experience in Splunk. The idea here is that these "widgets" will provide new users ways to learn and work for efficiently within Splunk. Experienced users will also gain value. Splidgets were designed around very simplistic principles, using as simple a process as possible to provide value to Splunk users. This Splidget is a repository for all of your Splunk snippets.

NOTE: WHEN UPDATING TO A NEWER VERSION OF THIS APP, YOUR SPLUNKPAD LOOKUP FILE WILL BE OVERWRITTEN!! PLEASE BACK UP OR RENAME YOUR MASTER (spgt_splunkpad.csv) LOOKUP FILE BEFORE YOU UPGRADE! (e.g. spgt_splunkpad.last.csv) This file is located in etc/apps/spgt_splunkpad/lookups directory. Once upgraded, delete the spgt_splunkpad.csv file and change the name of your good copy back to spgt_splunkpad.csv OR manually copy and paste your backed up file into the lookups directory. 

Look for the easter egg view, "Easy Triage".

title: Password Security
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description: Password Security is a framework for monitoring password security that allows to find compromised passwords by checking Microsoft Windows authentication logs for usernames that contain passwords. Use case includes a set of rules to perform real-time regex search for passwords in usernames containing numbers, special characters etc. As a result, we form list of hostnames and affected users that are likely compromised – someone could see password on the screen when user mistyped it, also authentication failure is logged to Windows Event Log that is not encrypted. Thus, all accounts discovered by the use case must be investigated further. Dashboard displays list of hosts with compromised passwords, spikes of such authentication events and last 50 events.

title: HTML Readability/Mobilizer and CSS Selectors - TA-readability
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Version 0.1  (No proxy support)

Includes two custom commands. One to get a webpage and provide a "readable" version like mobilizer etc or like your smartphone browser when you double-tap the main text on a webpage both as simplified html and plain text. Long and short title and if the text is english a hopefuly useful five sentence summary of the main content.
It uses the library readability and pytease to do so. Input is the field url or any you specify with | readability input=xxx present in the previous results. for testing just do something like this:
| makeresults | eval url="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splunk" | readability 

cssselector
custom command that allows you to use css selectors against a field, provide a property you wish to extract like the href from an 
will provide the generated xpath and the values for the property
example:
| makeresults | eval url="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splunk" | readability  outputraw=true | cssselector item="href" selector="a"  output="href"

title: Splunk UBA SDK
description:
Harness the power of real-time advanced analytics Splunk UBA platform to build your own security use case. UBA SDK can be used by data scientists and engineers to build and run custom content on Splunk UBA. Custom content may include new machine learning models, anomalies, anomaly categories and tables for IoCs (indicators of compromise). UBA SDK can be used to deliver different types of models – supervised ML, unsupervised ML and statistical. Develop the models in Scala or Java, define custom configuration, package and load custom content on UBA. Test and Repeat.

Requires Splunk User Behavior Analytics version 4.0 or higher.

title: CMDB-to-ITSI
description:
The name of this app describes the functionality part of the real app-name "EL Data Quality Automation & Reporting by UMBRiO"(DQAR). More functionality will be added to this DQAR during the next year.

The audience of this app:
CMDB-to-ITSI is for customers who are using Splunk's ITSI and want to integrate their existing CMDB (in the meaning of ITIL configuration management database). This app is also for customers who know that there is also meaningful CI-data within that CMDB that could be leveraged by ITSI.

The high-level functionality of this app:
An easy way to consume CMDB data within Splunk and use within ITSI. Speeding up the delivery and improve the quality of ITSI.

Which CMDB's:
This version of the app is focused on HP Enterprise(now Micro Focus) uCMDB and ServiceNow.

Currently this app is under drastic construction as I'm working on a much better solution that:
- gets graph context within Splunk
- use a real graph database called Neo4j
- integrate CMDB to Splunk with easy searching and exporting
- use Splunk as a discovery source 
- use Splunk and graph as a reconciliation of all data
The new version will be completely different and this current app will be not supported anymore from the 1st October 2020.
If you want to know more about the new solution please reach out to me with "Contact Developer".

title: Sideview Admin Tools
license_name: Sideview Free Internal Use License Agreement
description:
This app contains some useful User Interfaces that we’ve developed for Splunk Administrators.

The most important is the Sideview Editor, which is a general interface for creating, editing and debugging Sideview XML views.

After that possibly the most interesting and practical piece is the License Monitor which has two parts. The first part is a dashboard that charts your indexing so far today, and predicts based on recent indexing rates whether or not you’re going to blow your license today. By drilling down on the spikes in the chart you can see breakdowns by source/index/host. The second part is an alert that you can enable, that will let you know when you’re headed for a violation so you can go and make the changes you need to BEFORE the violation occurs.

title: fatstacks sRTMS
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
fatstacks is Vulnerability Intelligence

Vulnerability Intelligence tells you what needs to be patched first, and where. It informs customers what items requires evaluation. Vulnerability Intelligence is the glue between a company’s Vulnerability Assessment process and a company’s Patching process.

fatstacks Unique Value Proposition

fatstacks identifies logical vulnerability from data indexed by Splunk and/or 3rd party sources.
fatstacks unique IP provides complete insight into what is running across your network, with your security risk “Vulnerability Intelligence” profile layer. All of this happens in realtime. We accomplish this via our proprietary mapping technology, normalizing raw data, and adding the Vulnerability profile

         Capture versions at a detailed level needed to identify known vulnerabilities
         Roll-up at Minor and Major Versions for License Compliance
         Identify software that reaches and/or passes end-of-life
         Provide the list of available patches when it exists

The Integrator has been developed in Java so it supports both Linux and Windows Splunk environments. The Integrator comes with custom commands as well the ability to run PI expressions, giving you significant data extraction capabilities to leverage Splunk’s reporting, alerting, dashboarding and the machine learning tool kit. By incorporating PI expressions into your searches you can aggregate and filter the raw PI data to reduce your data ingestion into Splunk.

title: OPSWAT Application Information API Connector
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This Add-On Provides 'Drag and Drop' integrations for v3 of the OPSWAT Application Information public API.

Information about the OPSWAT Application Information public API can be found here: 
https://www.opswat.com/products/metadefender/application-and-threat-intelligence-platform
https://onlinehelp.opswat.com/mdcloud/Application_Information_Lookup.html

Simply pass a MD5/SHA1/SHA256 hash to this application from a triggered alert and the handler will query the OPSWAT Application Information API and write a result to the index you have specified.

You must have an OPSWAT API key to use this Add-On and this Add-On must be configured after installation.

Note: This application is a community developed application and is not affiliated with OPSWAT. This was made to help the Splunk community easily integrate with the OPSWAT public API. 

This Add-On Requires Splunk CIM to be installed for operation: https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/1621/

title: Balabit Privileged Account Analytics
description:
Balabit’s Privileged Account Analytics (PAA) integrates detailed data from Balabit's Privileged Session Management solution, as well as a variety of contextual data and processes them using unique sets of algorithms, generating behavior profiles that are continually adjusted using machine learning. For example, PAA can perform behavioral biometric analysis, which detects deviations in keystroke dynamics and mouse movements providing continuous authentication without users changing any of their normal behavior.

Privileged Account Analytics contains 13 algorithms which are continuously analyzing 17 behavioral characteristics, including:
• Time of login
• Activity type
• Used host
• Issued commands
• Window title (used application)
• Keystroke dynamics
• Mouse movement dynamics

title: Balabit Privileged Access Management
description:
Balabit’s Privileged Access Management protects organizations in real-time from threats posed by the misuse of high risk and privileged accounts. Solutions include Privileged Session Management (PSM) and Privileged Account Analytics (PAA), which together help organizations prevent, detect, and respond to cyberattacks involving privileged accounts, including both insider threats and external attacks using hijacked credentials.

PAA integrates detailed data from PSM, as well as a variety of contextual data and processes them using unique sets of algorithms, generating behavior profiles that are continually adjusted using machine learning. PAA can perform behavioral biometric analysis, which detects deviations in input device dynamics providing continuous authentication without users changing any of their normal behavior.

PAA contains 5 algorithms which are continuously analyzing 10 behavioral characteristics, including:
• Time of login
• Activity type
• Used host
• Issued commands
• Keystroke dynamics

title: TA-Volatility
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Manually parsing, analyzing and visualizing memory analysis is painful and time consuming.
Now you can ingest your memory analysis plugin outputs into Splunk for visualization and aggregate analysis!
The possibilities are limitless once you have your data in a central location.
This add-on can even be deployed to a remote systems and forwarded to an indexer or cluster!
See our github for the latest fork of volatility (https://github.com/mutedmouse/volatility) and the branches of TA-volatility (https://github.com/mutedmouse/ta-volatility).

NOTE: listprocess custom command syntax MUST match the following OR SEARCH WILL STALL and manual process termination will be required:  
__search__ | listprocess root_process_id=integer_pid process_field=name_field ppid_field=ppid_field pid_field=pid_field
This syntax is presented in the help message when you begin entering listprocess command in the search bar and documented under searchbnf.conf for listprocess.
Command improvements coming in 2.6.7 and above releases.

title: MV-table
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Custom command to generate table from multivalue events 
example for wsus data:

| mvtable  mvfields="kbnumber,arrival_date" keepfields="host,OS,_time" | table *

mvfields: fields containing several values, cardinality of the first field in the list is assumed to be the desired number of output rows. keepfields: specify the single value fields to be retained on each resulting row.

Example from the screenshot:
| makeresults | eval kbnumber="1234 5678 9012" | eval arrival_date="2019.05.17 2019.05.17 2019.05.17 2019.05.17" | eval host="test" | eval OS="Windows 10"
| eval kbnumber=split(kbnumber," ") | eval arrival_date=split(arrival_date," ")
| mvtable mvfields="kbnumber,arrival_date" keepfields="host,OS,_time" | table *

title: TA-ArubaOS
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This TA was developed from a limited sample dataset from an ArubaOS syslog source

The TA should be compatible with ArubaOS 6.x-7.x at of 03 May 2018

Field extractions were based on documentation from Aruba available at

	ArubaOS 7.4 Syslog Message Reference Guide
	https://support.arubanetworks.com/Documentation/tabid/77/DMXModule/512/Command/Core_Download/Default.aspx?EntryId=15307

As my sample logs had a different timestamp format than the documentation indicates, you may need to adjust your TIME_FORMAT variable in props.conf. My sample files looked like
	May  3 12:09:09 2018
Where as the documentation indicates a format of
	May  3 12:09:09

I included a commented out value for TIME_FORMAT that matches the documented version

title: SA-croniter
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Custom command to parse cron notation into epoch timestamps. Takes the search earliest time of the search as time from whence the next occurrence of the cron will be.

Parameters are input=fieldname and timerange=numberInSeconds default to just providing next_epoch

Example:
index=_internal [
| makeresults  | eval cronstring="*/5 * * * *" | croniter input=cronstring timerange="1" | eval nice_next_epoch=strftime(next_epoch,"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") 
| fields earliest,latest | format ]

Will search events one second before the cron task runs till one second after

title: Syncsort Ironstream RMF III Monitor
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
The Syncsort Ironstream RMF III Monitor provides visibility into z/OS RMF III data to assist with business decisionsions related to hardware resource consumption and utilization. Splunk and Ironstream together allow for long-term historical trending, with the ability to detect anomalous behavior.

RMF III records provide z/OS hardware monitoring information at the RMF interval, which is typically more granular than the fifteen-minute SMF interval. RMF III provides access to over 55,000 different fields, all of which are dynamically configured through the Ironstream Desktop GUI interface.

This dashboard uses the above records to examine the following metrics:

CPU Utilization
Total Mainframe (CEC) Utilization
Workload Manager Delay
WLM Usage Distribution
Execution Velocity
zIIP Engine Utilization

title: ITSI module for Influxdata Telegraf OS
description:

The ITSI module for Influxdata Telegraf provides entities discovery, services templates, KPI base searches and entity health views for Telegraf Operating System metric ingested in the Splunk metric store.
Additional support (currently Health views) is provided for Windows roles: Active Directory DCs, DNS, DFS, IIS/ASP.NET

title: ACT Threat Intelligence
description:
Semi-Automated Cyber Threat Intelligence (ACT) is a research project led by mnemonic with contributions from the University of Oslo, NTNU, Norwegian Security Authority (NSM), KraftCERT and Nordic Financial CERT.

The main objective of the ACT project is to develop a platform for cyber threat intelligence to uncover cyber attacks, cyber espionage and sabotage. The project will result in new methods for data enrichment and data analysis to enable identification of threat agents, their motives, resources and attack methodologies.

This add-on supports querying the ACT Threat Intelligence platform directly from splunk.

title: Splunk Add-on for OPC
description:
The Splunk Add-on for OPC is a component of the Splunk for Industrial IoT bundle. This add-on allows a Splunk Enterprise administrator to stream metrics and alarms data from OPC servers to the Splunk platform. This add-on applies transformations to your data to make it compatible with the IoT common information model so that you can use the data in Splunk for Industrial IoT. 

This add-on supports OPC UA servers as well as OPC DA and AE servers through the UA Gateway. If you have legacy OPC DA or AE servers from which you want to collect data, you must install the UA Gateway on those servers with a license key that allows connections from the Splunk Add-on for OPC.

To get the complete value of Splunk for Industrial IoT across all use cases, download Splunk Enterprise, Splunk Industrial Asset Intelligence, and Splunk Machine Learning Toolkit. For more information about Splunk for Industrial IoT, see https://www.splunk.com/en_us/software/splunk-industrial-asset-management-and-intelligence.html

The IBMi Security app processes data from the QAUDJRN security journal.  A Splunk index containing the following QAUDJRN entry types are required: 
•	AF 	Authority failure
•	CD 	Command string audit
•	CO 	Create object
•	CP 	User profile changed, created, or restored
•	DO 	Delete object
•	OM 	Object move or rename
•	OR 	Object restore
•	PW 	Invalid password
•	SV 	System value changed

title: ccure add-on

description:

Hardware Requirements

  -This add-on was tested with C-Cure 800/8000 Access Control + Security
  Management Solutions. There could be syntax differences in logs between other

Installation Steps
  1. Install db_connect. https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2686/
    a. for help with db_connect installation/setup please visit
    https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/DBX/3.1.3/DeployDBX/Checklist.
    b. Under the "New Input" (Metadata) make sure of the following
      - Sourcetype = ccure:journal
      - Index = ccure
  2. Install this add-on for the following Splunk Servers
    a. Search Head(s) / Indexer(s)
      - If this is building into the Enterprise Security app. Please
       install the CIM app on your Enterprise Secrity Search.
       https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/1621/

Additional
    Incorrect Timestamps could be related to a variety of reasons. Please Check
    the following items.
    1. db_connect: Under "Configurations" double check "Timezone" is setup
    2. Splunk: Under the login drop menu in "Preferances" double check "Timezone"
    is setup.
    3. For additional support please visit the community forum
    https://answers.splunk.com/index.html.

Redacted Log Sample
2018-12-20 13:29:58.000, MessageUTC="2018-12-20 18:29:58.0", MessageType="CardAdmitted", PrimaryObjectName="liechtenstein, ulrich", PrimaryObjectIdentity="AA11A11A-AA11-11AA-A1A1-AAAAAA111111", SecondaryObjectName="potentially the name of entrance area", SecondaryObjectIdentity="B2B2B2B2-BB22-22BB-B2B2-BBBBBB22222", XmlMessage="InDirection12345AdmitAdmitliechtenstein, ulrichpotentially the name of entrance area"

if you'd like to attribute additional redacted log samples or have comments/concerns. Please contact me at mfeeley@nuharborsecurity.com with the Subject line containing the add-on name.

title: papercut add-on
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Technical Add-on for PaperCut version 1.0.0

For documentation, see: https://www.papercut.com/support/resources/manuals/ng-mf/common/topics/customize-data-access.html

Hardware Requirements
PaperCut NG/MF

Installation Steps - Best practice
  1. Copy original "TA-papercut" and create "TA-papercut_inputs"
    a. Within the TA-papercut_inputs/ create a local folder. 
    b. Copy the inputs.conf from the default folder into the local folder. 
    c. Edit the inputs.conf and change disabled=true to disabled=false

  2a. Install on the following machines (preferred)
        a. Deployment Server : place both add-on in
            $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/deployment-apps (linux) or
            $SPLUNK_HOME\etc\deployment-apps (windows).
        b. Deploy "TA-papercut" to Search Head(s) / Indexer(s).
        c. Deploy "TA-papercut_inputs" to Universal Forwarder(s) that contain your
            log files. Documentation from the URL above states they should be in some
            directory like below.
           C:\Program Files\PaperCut MF\server\logs\print-logs\printlog_*.log.
               - update inputs.conf monitor stanza if your host differs.
        d. Issue reload deploy server command
               - Splunk service should restart (not the OS)

  2b. Install on the following machines (no deployment server or cannot use it)
        a. Search Head(s) / Indexer(s) : place "TA-papercut" add-on in
            $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps (linux) or $SPLUNK_HOME\etc\apps (windows).
        b. Restart the Splunk service for each Search Head(s) / Indexer(s).
        c. Universal Forwarder(s) : place "TA-papercut_inputs" add-on in
            $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps (linux) or $SPLUNK_HOME\etc\apps (windows).
            Documentation from the URL above states your logs should be in a directory
            like below.
            C:\Program Files\PaperCut MF\server\logs\print-logs\printlog_*.log.
               - update inputs.conf monitor stanza if your host differs.

if you'd like to attribute additional redacted log samples or have comments/concerns. Please contact me at mfeeley@nuharborsecurity.com with the Subject line containing the add-on name.

title: Splunk Essentials for Predictive Maintenance
description:
#WELCOME TO SPLUNK ESSENTIALS FOR PREDICTIVE MAINTENANCE

This Splunk Essential for Predictive Maintenance is created for maintenance reliability leaders and engineers who are looking for ways to improve and optimize their current preventive maintenance program.  To do predictive maintenance right, you need to have the right amount of knowledge on how to process data and then apply machine learning techniques to achieve the desired results.   

Designed for interactive learning, this guide focuses on learning how to solve real problems with real data. Users are provided with details of the predictive maintenance methodology and performance data from airplane engine sensors and then asked to operationalize their analytics. 

The Splunk Essentials for Predictive Maintenance takes you through 4 stages of the analytics process.  Each stage covers :
    * Methodology - designed to cover essential analytics knowledge to practice predictive analytics
    * Step-by-step - designed to apply the knowledge to already included dataset.

       - Stage 1: Data collection and ingestion focuses on how you can easily use Splunk software to collect, store, and structure asset metrics (dataset from airplane jet engines included).
       - Stage 2: Data exploration covers key methods for pre-processing and exploring data to help you understand the type of data in use and the characteristics of the dataset, which is crucial for getting the desired outcome.
       - Stage 3: Analysis teaches you 3 key analysis options (Anomaly Detection, Unsupervised Learning, Supervised Learning) for performing predictive maintenance analysis. In the supervised learning section, there is a complete guide to training, creating, and applying machine learning prediction models to predictive maintenance datasets.
       - Stage 4: Operationalization teaches you how to apply the model to a broader implementation, and how to create reports and alerts for operational actions.


Installation guidelines : Precautionary instructions *** MUST READ ***
    - Install the Splunk Essentials for Predictive Maintenance app on a test instance separate from production infrastructure. The app contains a sample dataset and therefore you might not want to install it on production infrastructure.

Prerequisite : Splunk apps required.  *** MUST READ ***
     - The following apps are required to use the “Splunk Essentials for Predictive Maintenance” app. Go to https://splunkbase.splunk.com to get apps that are required.

     - Splunk Machine Learning Toolkit (4.1) : Splunk machine learning toolkit - https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2890/
     - Python for Scientific Computing : Python environment for machine learning - https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2882/
     - 3D Scatterplot - Custom Visualization : Visualization add-on for 3D scatter visualization - https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/3138/ (Compatible with all 7.X versions or Splunk Enterprise, you must download and install)

title: Radware DefensePro for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Protect the Data Center and Network Against Emerging Network Threats using Radware's DefensePro

DefensePro is part of Radware’s Attack Mitigation Solution and is an award-winning, real-time, perimeter attack- mitigation device that secures organizations against emerging network and applications threats. DefensePro protects the infrastructure against network and application downtime (or slow time), application vulnerability exploitation, malware spread, network anomalies, information theft and other types of attacks.
DefensePro provides the industry’s most advanced, automated protection from fast-moving threats, including from recent IoT-based attacks such as Mirai. It is uniquely built to overcome both the complexity and scale of today’s sophisticated IoT-based botnets. DefensePro also helps organizations win the ongoing security battle against availability attacks, by detecting and mitigating known and zero-day DoS/DDoS attacks in real-time. It protects against other security threats that are usually undetected by traditional DDoS mitigation tools, such as SSL-based flood attacks, attacks on login pages and attacks behind CDNs.
With DefensePro, Radware’s attack mitigation solution offers protection with the shortest mitigation time and broadest attack coverage. Radware provides a hybrid solution combining on-premise and cloud-based mitigation tools in a single integrated solution, designed to optimally block multiple attack vectors occurring in parallel.

Please note that this plugin is supported by Radware Professional Services (PS) team..
Any request for support or integration requirements should be directed to your local Radware team asking for a PS engagement offering.

title: Radware WAF AppWall for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Automated Protection from Zero-Day Web Attacks with Radware's Web Application Firewall (AppWall) 

Radware's Web Application Firewall (AppWall) ensures fast, reliable and secure delivery of mission-critical Web applications. AppWall is an ICSA Labs certified and PCI compliant WAF that provides complete protection against web application attacks, web application attacks behind CDNs, advanced HTTP attacks (slowloris, dynamic floods), brute force attacks on login pages and more.
By using both negative and positive security models - AppWall features not only the lowest false positives and minimal operational effort, but also robust protection against known and unknown (Zero-day) threats.

Please note that this plugin is supported by Radware Professional Services (PS) team..
Any request for support or integration requirements should be directed to your local Radware team asking for a PS engagement offering.

title: Joe Sandbox Add-on
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Joe Sandbox is the industry’s most advanced automated and deep malware analysis engine. With a unique multi-technology approach and using the latest machine learning techniques, Joe Sandbox enables security specialists to analyze files on Windows, macOS, Linux, Android and iOS operating systems. It provides an excellent detection rate, unmatched in-depth analysis and evasion resistance.

The Joe Sandbox Splunk Add-on enables to directly pipe forensic data from Joe Sandbox on-premise or Joe Sandbox Cloud to Splunk. Forensic data includes IOCs such as dropped files, contacted domains and IPs, system behavior, detailed network behavior, static file information and much more. 

Learn more about it here: https://github.com/joesecurity/Joe-Sandbox-Splunk-Addon

title: One Identity Safeguard for Privileged Sessions App for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
One Identity Safeguard for Privileged Sessions App for Splunk creates useful dashboards to
visualize your sessions audited with SPS. With this app, you can get an overview of your
audited sessions and pinpoint interesting ones to be able to investigate them further. Also,
if you have other sources of information about your audited hosts (for example, Microsoft
Windows logs or Unix/Linux logs), you can compare the two sources of information and see

Technical support is available to One Identity customers with a valid maintenance contract and customers who have trial versions. You can access the Support Portal at https://support.oneidentity.com/.

Claroty's fully integrated suite of cybersecurity products allows existing Splunk customers/users to reliably extend their existing SOC capabilities with advanced detection, triage, investigation and response capabilities.

title: Export Data
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
# Splunk Export Data plugin
This is a Splunk plugin providing a custom alert script to export data to disk.
The main reason for this plugin is to have a backup solution for a single instance Splunk configuration.

## Need for a simple export tool
Without this tool the advise of Splunk is to use low level disk copy tools to:
* Rotate the hot bucket to warm buckets and back them up. 
* Or to use low level disk copy tools to back up the hot bucket.
In either case it is complicated and/or still leaves the data in the hot bucket vulnerable.

title: Cavirin Companion App for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Cavirin Companion App for Splunk centralizes security findings and summary stats into a Splunk dashboard for SecOps users. The following features are supported in the Cavirin Splunk Dashboard:

1) Company-level Cyberposture score with Security and Compliance drill downs
2) Most Risky Asset Groups, Policy Packs, Environment and Service/OS based on a percent HIGH and MEDIUM+LOW failures to total PASS + FAIL findings passes
3) Asset Inventory by Service / OS and Environment
4) Prioritized issues (Top 50) at the company level
5) Audit trail of system events
6) Ability to customize Dashboard using Cavirin API and Splunk query language

The integration relies on Cavirin API and a Cavirin service account that is permissioned to have the Administrator role in the customer's Cavirin system.

title: SPL Rehab
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
PYTHON 3 UPGRADE NOTICE: V1.3.0 IS COMPATIBLE WITH 8.0 ONLY! USERS OF 7.X MUST USE VERSION 1.2.2

This has been designed to introduce a controlled step-through process for your searches and remove the pain of searching through the job inspector or search logs when your search hasn't worked as you expected. Have you ever found yourself looking at a search that hasn't produced the results you expected? Wondered why it took too long to run? When you are faced with the prospect of scouring the Job Inspector or deleting half your search to find the answers, we refer to it as entering "Rehab"! 

SPL Rehab will assist you in answering these questions, displaying key performance figures in charted form alongside your search results. SPL Rehab also enables you to step through each command within a search, viewing the performance metrics as you progress and inspect key fields that are of interest to you. 

Want to see your data in Field Summary form? No problem! It's just a click away. Whether you want to see your overall result count, search runtime, EPS, Lispy, Total Command invocations, or just your events as you step through. It's all in one place, on one screen, easily accessible for everyone! SPL Rehab is designed to take all the pain of a search investigation away. Transforming trips to Rehab from late nights to early finishes!

DEVELOPED IN ASSOCIATION WITH Hippo Digital. FOR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE VISIT WWW.HIPPODIGITAL.CO.UK

title: Browser Icon Changer
license_name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0
description:
An app to change the Splunk browser icon (favicon). 

When you have many tabs open, spread across to different Splunk environments (e.g. Prod vs non-Prod), this makes it easier to differentiate what each tab is for. You may also want to differentiate dedicated Splunk management instances (e.g. monitoring console or cluster master) from your main search head/s.

title: CounterCraft Deception Director
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
The Cyber Deception Platform is a pioneering solution used in large organizations that gives attackers access to fictitious data and applications that act as bait. CounterCraft identifies these targeted attacks in real time and actively responds to them; this way attacks occur in a controlled deception environment and enable us to discover the attacker’s motivations, tools, and techniques.

The profile of attackers can vary greatly: cyber-criminals, lone hackers, ex-employees, and nation state agencies. The Cyber Deception Platform allows companies to be one step ahead of them and study what information they are gathering, their motives and the techniques they use to penetrate defenses. This valuable information is used to take defensive action against threat actors and strengthen previously unidentified weaknesses in security systems to reduce the risk of a breach. Armed with this knowledge, organizations are better prepared to stop intrusions.

The Cyber Deception Platform is the first product that automates the design, implementation, supervision and maintenance of cyber deception campaigns, across an organization’s entire spectrum of digital assets, such as servers, mobile phones, web applications, mobile applications and Wi-Fi access points. This automation has the potential to reduce counterintelligence costs by up to 95% compared to manual techniques.

title: Log Miner App for Monitoring Splunk Event Patterns
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
The APP is developed to be useful for administrators who are managing the Splunk environment
It provides following quick insights:

1. Event patterns that are happening in Splunk environment
2. Drilldown to events related to an event pattern
3. Fields extraction from event patterns 
4. Health monitoring of Error or warning patterns
5. Show the events for which patterns are not available in the App event patterns DB

With the above insights, Administrators can quickly identify issues happening in their Splunk environments and resolve the issues.

We have mined patterns for the events generated by our development Splunk environment. These patterns may
cover only a subset of all possible patterns that Splunk generates in production environments. 

Interested users, please reach out to us using “Contact Us” page in the app for discovery of patterns 
relevant to your environment.

title: Auto Enable/Disable Reports for Splunk
description:
This app gives you the ability to schedule auto enabling or disabling of reports which may help you to circumvent scheduled maintenance, planned upgrades, or simply weekends with not personnel coverage. A report group can be selected by choosing one or more of the following filtering criteria
- Packaging Splunk application
- Name of saved search or report
- Owner
- Status (Enabled/Disabled)

There are two kinds of group actions available
1. Permanent Changes - This action will enable or disable all filtered reports
2. Timed Changes - This action will allow you to specify a schedule during which saved searches need to be enabled or disabled. A recurrence can also be specified for timed changes. Schedules are stored in a lookup table and can be managed by App > Manage > Manage Schedules

IntSights’ all-in-one External Threat Intelligence & Protection Suite equips enterprise security teams with unparalleled capabilities to detect, investigate, and neutralize external threats across the clear, deep, and dark web.

title: Splunk Alert Action for SAP Enterprise Threat Detection
description:
Securing your Intelligent Enterprise is more important than ever. That’s why SAP and Splunk are working together to ensure your business continuity with new integrations and solutions.

Splunk Alert Action for SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection helps eliminate security blind spots across your SAP environment. It proactively detects and mitigates security attacks before your mission-critical ERP applications are compromised. Splunk Alert Action for SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection provides a Custom Alert Action for sending alerts from Splunk to your SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection deployment.  A Setup UI is provided to configure the remote SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection server and Console Dashboard for debugging.  

SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection is powered by SAP HANA® and quickly identifies suspicious patterns at the application server and database level.  SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection identifies, analyzes, and neutralizes cyberattacks as they are happening, and before they damage your business infrastructure. This Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tool uses real-time intelligence to effectively manage your systems’ vulnerability to external and internal cybersecurity threats – and help ensure data protection.
•	On-premise deployment
•	System-wide security compliance
•	High-volume processing of security events
•	Preconfigured functionality and integration 

Learn more about SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection https://www.sap.com/products/enterprise-threat-detection.html

SAP® Enterprise Threat Detection is available direct from SAP. Call today 1-800-872-1727

title: TA for Symantec endpoint protection syslogs SingleNode
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Instead of traditional log forwarding now a days companies prefer to have data at single node data lakes like logstash or data diode.
In such architecture data format gets changed. This TA can parse symantec endpoint protection (SEP) syslog data receiving from data lakes.
Also provides CIM-compatibility to use with Splunk Enterprise apps, such as Splunk Enterprise Security and the Splunk App for PCI Compliance. Required sourcetypes are below:
1) symantec_ep_syslog : This will segregate data into 12 different sourcetypes
2) symantec:ep:syslog : This will parse data under single sourcetype.

Skurio's Digital Risk Protection SaaS platform provides targeted Threat Intelligence and Data Breach Detection capabilities.  It monitors search terms specific to your organization, such as domains, email addresses, IP addresses, or keywords. To use the app, you'll need a Skurio DRP subscription to our Cyber Threat Intelligence or BreachAlert platforms, and an API key.

Logichub will miss this event, because it was not available during the 30 minute time window. This action allows you to send a trigger to Logichub as soon as that event is available in Splunk to ensure Logichub is automatically triaging 100% of your alerts + notables.

title: QOMPLX Add-On for Splunk
description:
The QOMPLX Add-On for Splunk enables the ingestion of event data from QOMPLX’s Identity Assurance (IA) suite of services into Splunk Enterprise. QOMPLX event data is generated by streaming analysis of system logs and Active Directory authentication data to alert on some of the most devastating attack techniques involving lateral movement, privilege escalation, and credential compromise. The add-on augments existing data feeds with turnkey detections that include deterministic alerts (without false positives) for Golden Ticket, Silver Ticket, DCSync, and DCShadow attacks in near real-time, as well as heuristic-based alerts for Pass-the-Ticket, Pass-the-Hash, Overpass-the-Hash, Kerberoasting, and Skeleton Key attacks. Ingestion of additional event data is also supported, including alerts for other known attack techniques triggered by highly customizable rules built in the QOMPLX customer portal.

QOMPLX provides tools to integrate, contextualize, and analyze data from virtually any source to help organizations identify operational risk and inefficiencies throughout the enterprise. Learn more about QOMPLX at https://www.qomplx.com/.

Warning! This alert action will automatically contain a host, preventing network access until containment is manually lifted. Use caution, especially for sensors deployed to servers and also consider the detection severity levels that you want this action performed on.

title: sFlow Analyzer for Splunk
description:
sFlow Analyzer for Splunk collects and decodes sFlow samples using Wireshark. It is designed to provide visibility into VXLAN overlay traffic. A JSON-formatted event is generated for each sample with all decoded header fields. Any sFlow-capable switch can be used as a packet sniffer and sampled data can be decoded and indexed remotely. sFlow samples are UDP-encapsulated and can easily traverse L3 boundaries.
sFlow Analyzer for Splunk includes a dashboard which enriches sampled data with DNS, ethertype, IP protocol and TCP/UDP port lookups to generate top talker, destination and application charts. The sFlow Analyzer for Splunk dashboard has a radio button allowing users to choose how they want to visualize stats: underlay or VXLAN overlay. When VXLAN overlay is selected, all top talker, destination and application charts will show VXLAN overlay hosts and applications.

title: Chainkit for Splunk
description:
Chainkit brings military-grade tamper detection to Splunk and exposes anti-forensic tampering techniques that attackers use to evade detection and prolong dwell times inside a corporate network. Compatible with Splunk’s Advanced Data Integrity, Chainkit leverages any Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) and provides enterprise Quality of Service (QoS) to create unbreakable Chains of Custody (CoC) for all data types. Chainkit’s “assume breach” platform is always monitoring data and indicates as soon as tampering is detected.

Additionally, Chainkit increases audit readiness for log and audit trail requirements in ISO 27001, NIST 800, SOC 2 and more. Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) professionals use Chainkit artifact integrity to deliver more complete and conclusive forensic analysis reports.

title: Smart Education Insights App for Splunk
description:
The app is designed to provide an automated workflow for training machine learning models to predict student outcomes.

Within the app there is a pipeline on top of our Machine Learning Toolkit that allows users to follow some simple click-and-select steps to load their e-learning data and select some important features in the data. The app then decides how it should be processed by an ML algorithm – including automatically deciding how the data should be pre-processed in preparation for an algorithm.

Ultimately the app provides non-expert users with a recommended model to apply to their particular data to predict: how likely a student was to pass or fail; and how likely a student was to drop off the course.

There are also a set of dashboards that can provide some easy to understand reports using the predictive models.

title: Knowledge objects dependencies
description:
A splunk app for app developers to search and investigate dependencies between knowledge objects.

The app lists all dependencies between dashboards (views), prebuilt panels, saved searches, search macro's, lookup definitions and lookup tables. These are visualised in a tree-like manner. Dependencies can be viewed both upstream and downstream. Supported also are datasource dependencies, indicating that a KO uses data originating from another.

Also included are:
* an overview of broken references that developers may want to fix
* an overview of KO's without dependencies. Especially for KO's other than dashboards and saved searches this suggests they are unused and cleanup is in order.

The app is able to detect almost all KO references, but there are a few exceptions. Currently unsupported are links to reports, deprecated (as of 7.x) simple xml syntax and dynamic references using variable substitution.

title: AlgoSec App for Security Incident Analysis and Response (2.x)
description:
AlgoSec’s business-driven security policy management solution helps make enterprises more agile, secure and compliant.

Through a single pane of glass, AlgoSec provides holistic visibility across the entire network security infrastructure, including business applications and their connectivity flows. With AlgoSec users can auto-discover application connectivity, proactively analyze risk from the business perspective, and intelligently automate time-consuming security changes—all with zero-touch, and seamlessly orchestrated across any heterogeneous environment.

Through AlgoSec’s integration with Splunk, this App enhances and automates the Security Incident Response process by:

· Augmenting security incident data with business context
· Automatically associating applications with compromised servers
· Identifying network connectivity to/from a compromised server
· Automatically isolating a compromised server from the network

End-user documentation: https://www.algosec.com/docs/en/asms/a30.10/asms-help/content/afa-admin/integrating-asms-with-splunk.htm?Highlight=splunk

title: Intel 471 Vulnerability Intelligence Add-on - DEPRECATED
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Intel 471’s Vulnerability Intelligence is made to both provide relevant and timely intelligence information on the adversary situation and to address the gap in current vulnerability offerings, which focuses mainly on things already being exploited in the wild based on known attacks and open source information. This leaves out the precursors to such activity that lend to a more proactive approach such as an increase in interest levels amongst threat actors, proof-of-concept (POC) code being developed, traded or sold, and ultimately the weaponization and productization of the code as it gets integrated into exploit kits, exploit packs or other tools. This activity often takes place prior to attacks being observed in the wild.

The Intel 471 Vulnerability Intelligence Add-on will automatically ingest vulnerability Intelligence reporting from the Intel 471 Titan platform and make all data available via Splunk searching. The add-on can be used standalone, but is best used alongside the Intel 471 Vulnerability Splunk App that replicates the Titan vulnerability dashboard within Splunk. The app and add-on require an Intel 471 Titan API key. Please contact vulnintelsupport@intel471.com for more information.

title: FRED Add-On for Splunk
description:
FRED® Add-On for Splunk

The FRED® Add-On for Splunk provides a way to easily retrieve FRED (Federal Reserve Economic Database) data and send into Splunk.

GitHub Repository: https://github.com/dmuegge/TA_mts_federal_reserve

"This product uses the FRED® API but is not endorsed or certified by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis."
https://fred.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/terms_of_use.html

What is FRED®?
FRED® stands for Federal Reserve Economic Data. FRED® contains frequently updated US macro and regional economic time series at annual, quarterly, monthly, weekly, and daily frequencies. FRED® aggregates economic data from a variety of sources- most of which are US government agencies. The economic time series in FRED® contain observation or measurement periods associated with data values. For instance, the US unemployment rate for the month of January, 1990 was 5.4 percent and for the month of January, 2000 was 4.0 percent.

source: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/fred/fred.html

title: Economic Analysis for Splunk
description:
The goal of Economic Analysis for Splunk is to provide users of Splunk easy access to public economic data. The application has visualizations for a core set of data and can be customized to use any data provided by the FRED® Add-On for Splunk.

The first and primary data source this application utilizes is FRED®, which is the Federal Reserve Economic Database. It is a widely used source of economic data and has a wealth of information. There are hundreds of data sources available from this repository this application uses many, which include the following:

- Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (US)
- U.S. Department of the Treasury
- U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis
- U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics
- U.S. Bureau of Transportation Statistics
- National Bureau of Economic Research
- U.S. Census Bureau
- S&P Dow Jones Indices LLC
- NASDAQ OMX Group


This product uses the FRED® API but is not endorsed or certified by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.
https://fred.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/terms_of_use.html

Using the FRED Add-On for Splunk to easily index the FRED data will make the data available to this application. The default data sources will populate the prebuilt dashboards, but additional data sources can be added and additional dashboards created.

Other data sources may be added to this application in the future based on the availability of additional applicable add-ons.

GitHub Repository: https://github.com/dmuegge/mts_economic_analysis

title: Azure blob storage archiving
description:
The Splunk Add-on for Azure blob storage archiving application documentation provides a robust and smart archiving framefork solution for Splunk Enterprise and Azure blob storage.

It relies on the Splunk built-in archiving capabilities and Azure blob storage and tables via the usage of the Python SDK for Azure.

The framework and concept can be summarised the following way:

- Splunk automatically calls the AzFrozen2Blob.py Python script when a bucket is frozen from cold storage (assuming archiving is enabled on the index)
- The Python script accesses an Azure storage account and verifies in a pre-defined Azure storage table if that bucket ID has been archived already (management of buckets replication for Splunk indexers in cluster)
- If the bucket has not been archived yet, a tgz archive of the bucket is created and uploaded to the pre-defined container in Azure blob
- If the upload to blob is successful, the Python script inserts a new record in the Azure storage table with all the useful information related to this bucket
- If the upload is successful, the script exists with an error code=0 which instructs Splunk that the bucket can be frozen, otherwise the script exit=1 and a new attempt will be made automatically by Splunk

See: https://ta-azure-blob-archiving.readthedocs.io

*** This is application is for Splunk Enterprise on-premise or private Clouds only, and not intented to be deployed on Splunk Cloud ***

title: Owl Diode Sender Add-On
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This Add-On works together with the Owl Diode Receiver Add-On (https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/5555/).

It is designed to send data between Splunk servers that can pass through a Owl Data Diode, while preserving the Splunk metadata.

The sender will encapsulate Splunk metadata like sourcetype, source, host, _time into the _raw message which can then be forwarded over UDP or TCP. The receiver will unpack this and populate the metadata fields as well and restore the _raw to its original state.

title: MIME String Decoder
description:
This Add-on provides a command to convert the MIME encoded string to readable string.
For example, you can convert the encoded Email Subject to readable string.

Note, some MIME encoded string can't converted properly. It will ignored by default.
For the GB2312 encoding, it will decoded with GB18030. Because the GB18030 covered the character of GB2312.

This Add-on support these codecs:
_codecs_cn
_codecs_hk
_codecs_iso2022
_codecs_jp
_codecs_kr
_codecs_tw
Unicode
UTF-8

If the subject can't decode properly, you can try to download the codecs and copy to this path 'MMDecode/lib'.

Usage:
index=email 
| table email_subject, email_filename 
| mmdecode email_subject, decoded_subject  
| mmdecode email_filename, decoded_filename

title: Activu vis/ability Link plugin
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Configured specifically to a customer's operational environment, Activu Link for Splunk filters the most important live incident data, and seamlessly displays the correlated incident content wherever it's needed.

Activusers configure Link to identify  Splunk incidents by category, severity, type, originator, age, content, or other factors. Related incident content—like dashboards, websites, streaming content, and more—are specified by the Activuser and managed within vis/ability as Sources. Alternately, Source content captured in a database, spreadsheet, comma-delimited file, or part of a custom incident table element can be provided to Activu as a lookup table, for access by our integration team.

Management for the display of incidents and their related Source content—such as where they should appear, at what size, labeling, borders, and more—are defined within the Activu Link configuration tool.

As a result, Link automatically makes the selected incidents more visible throughout an organization by directing the defined content to shared Displays, virtual displays in vis/ability, called Spaces, and directly to users on Desktop and Mobile devices.

Gain insights into infrastructure using CPU, Memory, Disk Metrics and more
Uses the metrics input so performance will be significantly quicker than standard perfmon

Dashboards
Contains overview dashboards for simple views, as well as metrics and drill downs for more advanced insights.

Reports
Create and manage thresholds and host information with reports that will fill with information when run

Alerts
Comes with alerts for Network, CPU, Memory, Paging File and Disk, ranging from simple to advanced.

Dependencies
Requires data from Splunk Add-on for Microsoft Windows Metrics store
Splunk Add-on for Microsoft Windows 
Use the app TA_Distinct_Performance_Inputs to get the inputs required and props for pagefile data.

Github
Further documentation located on the github page
https://github.com/dwaynegeffroy/distinct_windows_performance

title: Windows Personal Security
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Welcome to Windows Personal Security!  WPS transforms your Windows data into high fidelity visualizations, empowering you to monitor and analyze a continuous stream of data at a glance and perform basic cybersecurity investigations in Splunk. WPS is the easiest way to gain visibility into Windows endpoints and harness the power of the machine data at your fingertips.

WPS utilizes Windows event logs and Sysmon log data and includes 6 dashboards and 36 pre-built security alerts that provide insight into system performance and security.  WPS provides an overview of critical endpoint activities, including network connections, system services, process creation, authentication, commandline, Powershell, and browser activity.

Add an additional layer of defense for your Windows computers and enhance your cybersecurity skills with Windows Personal Security.

title: Windows Process Monitor
description:
Runs a powershell script to check the status of a process, whether it is up or down, standard logs do not provide the down but only the absence of, which can cause problems when there is log delays or outages.

For more details go to the GIT repository  https://github.com/dwaynegeffroy/TA_Process_Monitor

title: OpenIntelligence Natural Language Interface Splunk App
description:
The  OpenIntelligence Natural Language Interface for Splunk (openintelligence-nli-app) allows both Splunk novices and experience Splunk users to search for information or define complex correlation rules in their own language. 
The interface uses an entity driven approach (e.g. devices or accounts) to incrementally build complex natural language queries (a subset with a very precise and unambiguous semantic) and translate them to the Splunk SPL query language. 
These entities also help to identify suitable queries and automatically generate joining attributes between different event types.
This initial version of the App offers two different natural language wizards. Later version will complement these wizards with a natural language search bar.
For additional documentation or access to the latest version of this app, please visit https://openintelligence.com.au/products/onli-app.

title: XML Formatter
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This app provides a custom streaming command to format XML based events/fields.

For bug reports / feature requests please use github: https://github.com/dglauche/TA-xmlformatter

title: Cisco Suite for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Cisco Suite for Splunk is an App, which gives overview about most of the Cisco Log sources available in Splunk.

Install this App on your Search Head. Also install required add-ons for all your Cisco log sources(Eg: Cisco Networks Add-on, Cisco WSA,Cisco ESA, Cisco Sourcefire....)

Mainly covers below Cisco devices,
Cisco ASA
Cisco ISE
Cisco ESA
Cisco WSA
Cisco Sourcefire
Cisco IOS Switch/Router

title: Automox Dashboard for Splunk
description: The Automox Dashboard for Splunk is used for visualizing data that has been ingested from the Automox platform through the use of the accompanying Automox Technology Add-On. The dashboard is designed for users to quickly get started with data visualizations related to Automox events, endpoints, and policy details.

title: IBM Z Common Data Provider - Dashboards
description:
Need help getting your mainframe data into Splunk? IBM Z Common Data Provider (CDP) is the answer.

The IBM Z Common Data Provider dashboards are an extension of the CDP core product. These dashboards give users the ability to visualize mainframe data in Splunk alongside their distributed data. Z operational data is shown from SYSLOG and SMF and enables operators to quickly visualize application performance and potential error conditions for CICS, Db2, MQ and z/OS.

title: Splunk DFS Manager
description:
[Note: Splunk Data Fabric Search (DFS) is no longer available for purchase as of May 20, 2020. Splunk Enterprise 8.x customers may continue to use the free version of Splunk DFS included with their Enterprise license. Version 1.1 is the final release of Splunk DFS, and version 1.2 is the final release of the accompanying Splunk DFS Manager app. There will be no additional major or minor releases of either product. Splunk DFS 1.1 and the Splunk DFS Manager app 1.2 will be supported until the October 22, 2021 end-of-support date of Splunk DFS 1.1. See the Splunk Software Support Policy for details.]

The Splunk DFS Manager app enables you to run Data Fabric Search (DFS). The app automatically bundles, installs, and configures Apache Spark that is required for DFS. Additionally, the app helps you to continuously and seamlessly manage, configure, and monitor your Spark cluster and customize the resource allocation within your DFS deployment from any search head through a scalable and adaptive user interface to run a DFS search.

Splunk DFS Manager installation and configuration:
    1) Decide how many workers are required.
    2) Provision nodes to run as workers. 
    3) Add the nodes as distributed search peers to the search head.
    4) Install the app on the search head and search peers.
        - For indexers in an indexer cluster: Install the app using a cluster master.
        - For search heads in a search head cluster:Install the app using a search head cluster deployer.
    5) DFSmaster automatically starts on the search head (in standalone mode) and on the search head captain in a search head cluster.
    6) Access the Splunk DFS manager UI on the search head that runs as the DFS master.
    7) Add the provisioned search peers as the DFS workers.
    8) Run a DFS search.
 
Splunk DFS Manager capabilities:
    - High availability that allows an alternate search head captain to restart the Spark master, in case the search head captain fails.
    - Customize resource usage by leveraging workload management (WLM) to allocate CPU and memory.
    - Add DFS workers on all or selected search peers.
    - Remove a DFS worker.
    - Restrict adding DFS workers to a particular site in a multi-site environment.
    - Monitor the health and resource usage of the Spark cluster.
    - Enable Spark security.

title: Strava for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This add-on will retrieve your activities and second-by-second heart rate, cadence, power and more from Strava for easy analysis in Splunk. It allows you to not only view your own data, but you can add your friends or co-workers as well for some healthy competition.

Documentation can be found on https://bakermat.github.io/TA-strava-for-splunk.

For feedback or any issues you encounter, please head to the repo on https://github.com/bakermat/TA-strava-for-splunk.

title: SMSEagle SMS Alert
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This app will allow you to send SMS alerts from Splunk without using Internet connection.

The app allows to send text messages from your Splunk instance directly to 3G/4G network using SMSEagle. SMSEagle device sends SMS directly to cellular network. There is no third-party external services between. This ensures full security and privacy of information shared across your IT infrastructure. And your SMS will get through even if your Internet connection fails.
How to use it?
1) Get your SMSEagle 
2) Insert your SIM card into SMSEagle 
3) Connect SMSEagle to your IT infrastructure
4) Configure the app in Splunk 

Now you can send SMS alerts from your Splunk instance directly to 3G/4G network.

title: Trend Micro - InterScan Messaging Security (IMSVA) Add-on for Splunk
description:
Trend InterScan Messaging Security (IMSVA) Technology Add-on (TA) for Splunk provides knowledge object extractions and resolution lookups for IMSVA Message Trace, Policy Enforcement and ERS.
This add-on also provides CIM-compliant knowledge for use with Splunk Premium and CIM-based apps.

title: Docker Analyzer
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This Splunk app contains scripted inputs for Docker stats, top, logs, events collection.
It enables complete Docker monitoring using all in one solution: data collection, storage and visualization.
Few Splunk dashboards allow deep analysis of Docker data in a simple yet powerful way.

title: Splunk Supporting Add-on for NetApp
description:
To provide the best experience for Splunk users who want to monitor their infrastructure, Splunk is refocusing engineering efforts on our IT Essentials Work and IT Service Intelligence offerings. As a result, we will End Of Sale Splunk SupportingAdd-on for  NetApp on April 30, 2021 and End of Life on January 20, 2023 .

We highly recommend that customers either purchase IT Service Intelligence and utilize the Content Library and Content Packs for pre-built service-level dashboards and KPIs, or use the latest version of Splunk IT Essentials Work 4.9 (available May 2021) to monitor host level data. For more details on this announcement and migration options, please refer to our blog post and contact your sales representative with any questions.

Splunk supporting add-on for NetApp is a collection of dashboards that provides instant operational visibility into health of your NetApp Data ONTAP storage systems. IT professionals can quickly visualize configuration, logs and performance of all their NetApp Data ONTAP storage systems in both 7-Mode and Cluster-Mode with quick drill-downs to specific sub-systems including filer, aggregate, volume, disk and other events.
The dashboards leverage data collected using Splunk add-on for NetApp ONTAP. The dashboards from Splunk Supporting Add-on for NetApp also works as a complementary app along with IT Essentials Work. With the two apps installed customers can monitor health of your NetApp Data ONTAP storage systems.

title: uberAgent Browser Extension Inventory (Chrome Edge Firefox)
description:
Browser extension inventory dashboard with support for Chrome, Edge, and Firefox. Shows extensions over time, extension versions, users, hosts, and more.

This app visualizes the data collected by the script described in the uberAgent practice guide "Building a Browser Extension Inventory Report" (link in the details tab).

title: SA-geodistance
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
This add-on computes the relative distance of adjacent events with coordinates.
By default, distance is returned in kilometres, the a parameter can be added to return the distance in miles

title: Windows SOHO Security
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Windows SOHO Security centralizes security operations for small office and home office environments with one or more Windows endpoints. Windows SOHO Security transforms data from 15 Windows event logs into high fidelity visualizations, empowering you to monitor a continuous stream of data, perform investigations, and improve the security posture of your SOHO network. With Windows SOHO Security, you can manage security for multiple Windows computers and harness the power of the machine data at your fingertips.

Windows SOHO Security features 10 dashboards, including a security operations center, 52 pre-built security alerts, MITRE integration, built-in security reports and custom drilldowns that you can build upon to suit your needs.

Windows SOHO Security provides visibility into a wide range of endpoint activities, including network connections, system services, scheduled tasks, WMI, authentication and logon events, Windows updates, Microsoft Office apps, command shell, Powershell, firewall, and browser activity.  With Windows SOHO Security, you can add a powerful layer of defense for one computer or centrally manage all of your computers.

title: Broadcom Compliance Event Manager App for Splunk
description:
Broadcom Compliance Event Manager for z/OS can send any of the monitored events to Splunk for additional monitoring and/or alerting.  Broadcom Compliance Event Manager can be used to monitor the following list of events (and more) for all three External Security Managers for z/OS, Broadcom ACF2, Broadcom Top Secret, as well as IBM RACF, such as:
- User administration
- Policy administration
- Control option administration
- IPL member changes
- USS file changes
- TCPIP connections
 
The Broadcom Compliance Event Manager App for Splunk provides pre-configured reports and dashboards to easily isolate and visualize Mainframe security event data sent from Compliance Event Manager to Splunk.  

z/OS and RACF are registered trademarks of IBM Corporation.

title: Adaptive Shield Add-on
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Adaptive Shield leads the SaaS Security Posture Management (SSPM) domain, enabling security teams to locate and fix configuration weaknesses quickly in the SaaS environment, ensuring compliance with company and industry standards.
 - Proactively find and fix weaknesses across your entire stack by continuously monitoring all your SaaS apps, detecting any security misconfigurations, incorrect permissions, and any possible exposure
 - Ease your fixing process by getting full risk context and a remediation plan to track progress, validate and monitor risk reduction
 - Catch configuration drifts as they happen and prevent minor incidents from becoming major problems

Integrating Adaptive Shield's platform with Splunk Enterprise or Splunk Cloud is enabled by Adaptive Shield's public API using the user's private API Key.

The Adaptive Shield add-on provides:
 - An Account Dashboard - an overview of the account posture, general insights, integrations status, and alerts
 - Landscape - showing all app types monitored in your account with their current posture score
 - Security Checks - the foundational entity in your account, covering a specific security setting or configuration in each monitored app

The Adaptive Shield add-on helps to utilize Splunk as a one-stop-shop for SaaS Security posture and configuration drifts.

title: Schedule Visualizer App for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Schedule Visualizer App for Splunk  helps in graphically displaying cron schedule for saved searches in your Splunk environment. It is based on newly released Splunk Dashboard Studio and helps in quickly identifying the following:

* Bottlenecks in the cron schedule by clearly indicating them in color coded categories of Red, Yellow and Green
* Dynamically calculating theoretical maximun saved searches supported by your Splunk environment and use these thresholds to categorize cron schedules by minute.

This app comes with two dashboards 

* Schedule Visualizer for Dashboard Studio
* Schedule Visualizer for Heatmap

title: Ironstream IBM i Security
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Ironstream® IBMI Security app includes dashboards intended to give a flavor of what is possible with the Ironstream for IBM i.

The IBM i Security app processes data from the QAUDJRN security journal. A Splunk index containing the following QAUDJRN entry types are required:
• AF Authority failure
• CD Command string audit
• CO Create object
• CP User profile changed, created, or restored
• DO Delete object
• OM Object move or rename
• OR Object restore
• PW Invalid password
• SV System value changed

Many more Journals and Queues can be monitored by Ironstream.  This app shows only a small sample of what is possible.

NOTE:  Ironstream for IBM i is required to supply data for this app.

title: Ironstream SYSLOG Monitor
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Ironstream® unlocks real time mainframe operational intelligence. Capture mission-critical IBM® z/OS® data and make sense of the massive machine data streams from your mainframe.

Use SYSLOG data to analyze critical z/OS components in Splunk®:
- Batch Jobs
- Transaction and database sub-systems
- RACF Security
...plus much more.

Get a 360 degree view of your data with Ironstream:
- CICS®, Db2®, Log4j, SMF®
- Security information
- Performance metrics
- Analytics

IBM, z/OS, CICS, Db2, RACF, SMF are registered and/or trademarked words/phrases/symbols of IBM Corporation in the United States and other countries.

NOTE: Ironstream for IBM Z is required to supply data for this app.

title: Ironstream RMF III Monitor
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Ironstream® RMF III® Monitor provides visibility into z/OS® RMF III data to assist with business decisions related to hardware resource, consumption and utilization.  Splunk and Ironstream together allow for long-term historical trending, with the ability to detect anomalous behavior.

RMF III records provide z/OS hardware monitoring information at the RMF interval, which is typically more granular than the fifteen-minute SMF® interval. RMF III provides access to over 55,000 different fields, all of which are dynamically configured through the Ironstream Desktop GUI interface.

This app uses the above records to examine the following metrics:

- CPU Utilization
- Total Mainframe (CEC) Utilization
- Workload Manager Delay
- WLM Usage Distribution
- Execution Velocity
- zIIP® Engine Utilization

IBM, z/OS, RMF, RMF III, SMF, WLM, Workload Manager, zIIP are registered and/or trademarked words/phrases/symbols of IBM Corporation in the United States and other countries.

NOTE: Ironstream for IBM Z is required to supply data for this app.

license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content

Gain easy insight into how your z/OS® systems are performing:

Get detailed z/OS system performance data:

title: Guardicore Add-on for Splunk
description:
The Technology Add-on for Guardicore collects data from Centra using the REST API and processes events received from the Syslog exporter.  This data can be viewed with the Guardicore App for Splunk.

About Guardicore
Guardicore is a cloud and data center security company that protects your core assets using flexible, quickly deployed, and easy to understand segmentation and micro-segmentation controls. Our solutions provide a simpler and faster way to guarantee persistent and consistent security for any application, in any IT environment including IaaS, PaaS, on-premises VMs as well as legacy and old bare-metal servers.

title: Credit Card Information for Splunkstart
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description: This app contains 5 sample Dashboard Studios type dashboards containing various macros designed to work with and show various credit card related data including security and usage. This is an add on to the SplunkStart app.

title: NetMotion Mobility Add-on for Splunk
license_name: End User License Agreement for Third-Party Content
description:
Provides CIM field extractions and other useful field extractions, as well as sourcetype transforming based on the event for your NetMotion Mobility syslog data.

+ Currently Supports:
++ NetMotion Mobility Server Event Log (nmservic.exe)
+++https://help.netmotionsoftware.com/support/docs/MobilityXG/1130/help/mobilityhelp.htm#page/Mobility%2520Server%2Fmanage.07.014.html%23
